noun.description: A horse of a small breed, especially one whose height at the withers is below 14 hands 2 inches (58 inches).
A small drinking glass or the drink contained in it.
A literal translation of a foreign-language text, used illicitly by students; a trot.

verb.description: Pay (money), especially as a contribution or an unavoidable expense.
examples: getting ready to pony up for their children's college education

origin: Mid 17th century: probably from French poulenet small foal, diminutive of poulain, from late Latin pullanus, from Latin pullus young animal.
